alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:14AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of Benton, northern Carroll, northern Washington, southern Delaware, southern Creek, northern Adair, Wagoner, Cherokee, Okmulgee, northern Muskogee, southeastern Tulsa and Okfuskee Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 313 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 5 miles west of Exeter to 4 miles east of Sparks. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Broken Arrow... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Muskogee... Bentonville... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Okmulgee... Wagoner... Berryville... Okemah... Jay... Eureka Springs... Bella Vista... Bixby... Jenks... Okfuskee... Glenpool... Coweta... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 244. Interstate 49 between mile markers 64 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
